text: You know the saying,
love at first sight, right?
Well, what about love at first scent?
Maybe some of you have been thinking
buying some pheromones to put you
on the fast track to romance.
Before we get into whether or not
that’s a good idea, let’s take
a look at what pheromones are,
and if these things can
actually affect the way we think.
(Reactions Splash)
Entomologists first identified pheromones
in 1959 as chemical substances that
were used by insects to cause certain
behavioral reactions in their peers.
In other words, they were a
pretty impressive form of chemical
communication in the animal kingdom.
As research developed, pheromones were
identified in all walks of life,
including human beings.
However, studying pheromones in insects
is a cakewalk compared to humans,
because we are far more complex creatures.
There’s also many kinds of pheromones
out there, so let’s focus on the
pheromones called “releasers”– the ones
that involve sexual attraction.
Every individual lives in their own
sensory world, and this is the main
reason why studying human pheromones
is extremely difficult.
Personal history or even the context of a perceived
smell can affect an individual’s response to it.
For example, you may like the smell of
gasoline because your dad was a mechanic.
Someone else might hate it because
they were in a car accident.
Also, there isn’t a standard setup
for everyone’s olfactory system,
so each person has a different set
of chemical sensors in their nose.
Scientists haven’t been able to
isolate “releasers” in humans yet,

and it very well could be
due to these complications.
So if there aren’t any isolated
human releasers yet, what the heck are
they putting in those love potions you buy online?
Well, most of these contain trace
amounts of these three volatile compounds

(Text onscreen: androstenone,
adrostadienone, and androstenol).
Believe it or not folks, these are
in fact real releasers, and they do
work wonders but only if you are a pig.
No I’m not saying to put pheromones
on and act like a pig,
I’m saying that these are compounds
that have been isolated in pigs.
So if you’re feeling suave and dabbed a
little bit of this stuff on your wrists,
stay away from the farm.
It’s for your own good.
Now you might wondering, is there any
legitimacy about these store bought
releasers, or is it all just a cruel
joke on people starving for romance?
Science has proven the existence and
effectiveness of these pheromones in pigs,
yet a lot of the manufactures of these
pheromones claim that they work on humans
through the use of a specialized chemical
sensor tool called the vomeronasal organ.
We’ll folks, it doesn’t look like
they’ve done their research,
because a vomeronasal organ is basically
just a shell in humans and
isn’t even wired to our brains.
And on top of that,
the chemical pheromones in their products
aren’t even detected by the
vomeronasal organs of pigs.
So we’re pretty much left
in the dark when it comes to
lust inspiring pig smells.
So for all you looking for a quick path
to romance, sorry to burst your bubble,
but you’re just going to have to do it
the old fashioned way.
But you can try using some of your
newly-gained chemistry knowledge
to drive the guys or gals wild!
Thanks for watching folks, and
on the topic of chemical communication,
make sure to watch this video on
why dogs smell each other’s butts, or
maybe learn why garlic gives
you bad breath with this video.
And while you’re here, make sure to
check out ACS Webinars YouTube page,
it’s got tons of great content.
Just click this button here and
it will send you right there.
Don’t forget to subscribe.
